title: What are some examples of conformity? - Quora

response.answer_text: Imagine a worthless piece of rock with no intrinsic value. Now imagine as soon as you purchase the rock, it’ll lose a majority of its value. In fact, the person you purchased it from will offer you 20%, tops, of what you just paid. Now imagine that rock costs a shit ton of money. Rent for a month or more. A couple of international flights. A lot of money. So: 1) the rock has no productive use for you, and 2) it is not an investment, and 3) is expensive to buy. Who in their right mind would buy such a thing?   I offer you engagement ring as a big example of conformity. “Hey honey, we are starting our lives together. What should I use a whole lot of money for? Investments to secure our future? A vacation to spend time together? Charity to give back? Nah, lets give our money to a cartel so we can get a rock that’s good for nothing, except to tell other people we conform to their norms”  Full disclosure: I proposed to my wife with a ring with a rock that she wears proudly every day. I conform too.

Examples of conformity are reflected in individuals priorities in life. Examples would include believing that one’s purpose is to make as much money as fast as they can, a reflection of greed, to be obsessed with one’s physical appearance or looks, to “work hard” and “play hard,” a belief that one is entitled to drink excessively and engage in other self-destructive and addictive behaviors, if one is under a lot a stress from working, adherence to the standard American diet, a lack of exercise, physical activity and movement, sleep deprivation, a lack of spiritual growth, refusing to build social networks and communities that are based on quality instead of quantity, not understanding the importance of emotional intelligence and, as a result, have difficulty managing and controlling emotions, supporting candidates who are either Democrats or Republicans ….
